repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: Ref https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/7699#issuecomment-355659015. I will add test tomorrow.

comment_data.body: libuv resources should be freed in their respective "on close" handlers. Is that the problem?

I think it can be assumed that libuv frees handles at latest during the next loop iteration (but not in the middle of a still ongoing tick). Otherwise we will need to keep a second refcount on the channel struct just for "number of not yet closed libuv handles"

comment_regular_data.body:
asan build observed 2 hangs (haven't seen that before):

```

```

and a SEGV (maybe a bug in log_uv_handles or uv__print_handles which is only supposed to be used for "debugging purposes" so probably isn't robust):

```

= ==32813==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.
= ==32813==Hint: address points to the zero page.
=     #0 0x1a9cfef in uv__print_handles /home/travis/nvim-deps/build/src/libuv/src/uv-common.c:374
=     #1 0xe07e1b in log_uv_handles /home/travis/build/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/log.c:141:3
=     #2 0xa1a3c2 in loop_close /home/travis/build/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/event/loop.c:131:7

=     #10 0x122e93d in os_inchar /home/travis/build/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/os/input.c:110:19
=     #11 0x1709c2e in state_enter /home/travis/build/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/state.c:55:13

=     #15 0x44d1cb in _start (/home/travis/build/neovim/neovim/build/bin/nvim+0x44d1cb)
= 
= AddressSanitizer can not provide additional info.
= SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: SEGV /home/travis/nvim-deps/build/src/libuv/src/uv-common.c:374 in uv__print_handles
= ==32813==ABORTING
```

Actually closing pipes was not problematic, only the process handle itself (`uv_spawn` only "activates" the handle if the process spawned succesfully).

What I think we really need is to defer freeing the channel struct until after a uv loop iteration. `fast_events` is not good enough as it is a child-queue of the main queue, which can be processed _before_ uv loop is invoked (and not after as in `loop_poll_events`). I ended up using `loop_schedule`, this does what we want except that it is also thread-safe, but for now it is probably not worth adding a copy that avoids the mutex.

I get one remaining failure in `luaeval(vim.api.…) errors out correctly when working with API`, not sure if it is directly libuv related or just ASAN being able to detect a new existing error.

Also deps caching or something prevents libuv from being built with ASAN on travis. Though the current implementation is a hard-coded hack, I might need help from someone more familiar with our ci code. Modulo fixing the remaining luajit related error, I think we would want it to make incorrect libuv use fail quicker.
That luaeval ASAN failure looks like https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/6774, which is an upstream problem.

Unusual output from log_uv_handles(): https://gist.github.com/justinmk/802fc6f6343658358a3d623b626d46dc

```
===============================================================================
NVIM_LOG_FILE: /home/travis/build/neovim/neovim/build/.nvimlog
[--I] signal   0x30f96c8
[-AI] async    0x30f9510
[RA-] async    0x30f99a0
[R--] signal 0x30f97d0
<...much more...>
```
I was just testing if `log_uv_handles` would crash in general (it was behind an `if()` before), but it seems not to...

Hmm, the scrollbind test doesn't fail if I run it (still on ASAN travis) in isolation. The failure is weird anyway as scrollbind doesn't use any channels or any other IO except ordinary buffer load/save...
@justinmk Let me squash it and cycle travis a few times...

title: channels: fix use after free
